memberdef.name: size

briefdescription.para: Returns the number of elements along dimension dim.

detaileddescription.para:
Returns the number of elements along dimension dim.
A
matrix for which you want to know the size.
dim
Dimension along which you want the number of elements. 1 = number of rows, 2 = number of columns
An integer value of the number of elements along the desired dimension.

briefdescription.para: Returns the size of matrix A.

detaileddescription.para:
Returns the size of matrix A in a matrix_size_type variable. auto msize = size(A); int num_rows = msize.rows; int num_cols = msize.cols;
A
matrix for which you want to know the size.
A matrix_size_type variable containing the number of rows and cols.

briefdescription.para: Returns a matrix of size M x N containing all zeros.

detaileddescription.para:
Returns a matrix of size M x N containing all zeros.
M
Number of rows.
N
Number of columns.
An M x N matrix containing zeros for each element.

briefdescription.para: Returns a matrix of size M x N containing all ones.

detaileddescription.para:
Returns a matrix of size M x N containing all ones.
M
Number of rows.
N
Number of columns.
An M x N matrix containing ones for each element.

memberdef.name: linspace

briefdescription.para: Produces a vector containing N values equally spaced between x1 and x2, inclusively.

detaileddescription.para:
Produces a vector containing N values equally spaced between x1 and x2, inclusively.
x1
The minimum value.
x2
The maximum value.
N
The number of values between x1 and x2.
A vector containing N equally spaced values between x1 and x2, inclusively.

memberdef.argsstring: (const T x1, const T x2, int N)
memberdef.name: logspace

briefdescription.para: Produces a vector containing N values logarithmically spaced between 10^(x1) and 10^(x2), inclusively.

detaileddescription.para:
Produces a vector containing N values logarithmically spaced between 10^(x1) and 10^(x2), inclusively.
x1
The base 10 logarithm of the minimum value.
x2
The base 10 logarithm of the maximum value.
N
The number of values between 10^(x1) and 10^(x2).
A vector containing N logarithmically spaced values between 10^(x1) and 10^(x2), inclusively.

memberdef.name: eig

briefdescription.para: Generalized complex-valued eigenvalue solver using LAPACK function call.

detaileddescription.para: This function returns the eigenvalues(lambda) of the complex-valued generalized eigenvalue problem: Ax_r = lambda*Bx_r or x_l^T*A = lambda*x_l^T*B. The eigenvalues are returned by default. To return the right or left eigenvectors, supply the function with a complex<double> matrix object in the 3rd or 4th parameters, respectively.

memberdef.argsstring: (const matrix< complex< double >> &A_in, const std::vector< complex< double >> &b_in)
memberdef.name: linsolve

briefdescription.para: The keycpp namespace prevents KeyCpp functions and classes from interfering with other C++ libraries, for instance the std library.
